intro: Sebastiania corniculata var. ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty-seeded sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and distinctive, reddish-brown seeds. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forest understories or on rocky slopes. Its ornamental value is due to its unique seed capsules and foliage.
